captions.text: [MUSIC PLAYING]
-Hi.
It's Brooklyn and Bailey.

And for this week's video
we are doing a book review.

Before we get into
that, though, we

wanted to tell you
guys the outfits

we bought from
last week's video,
our thrift shop fashion video.
So.

-I bought the white lace shirt
and the green floral skirt
with the brown heel boots.

And I also got the leopard
hat and the skinny jeans

with the white lace shirt
and the brown shoes, again.

Because I love both
of the outfits,
and they just intermingled in.

They were both so cute,
so I got them both.

-I got this green knit sweater
and my gray [INAUDIBLE] print

leggings, because I
really loved this outfit.
And it was my favorite.
And so, on to the book review.
-OK.

So today I'm going to show you
my book called "Divergent."
This one's super popular.

And I think they're actually
making a movie into it, too.
-Yes.
I think it comes out 2014.
So look for it.

-It's about a society, how
they split themselves up
based on moral class.

So Candor is telling
the truth, honesty.
Amity is happiness.
Abnegation is selflessness?
-Is it service?
-Service?
Erudite is knowledge.

And Dauntless is
like, daring, bravery.

And each 16-year-old
teenager, when they turn 16,

had to take a test
that recommends them
to each moral class.

And when they're 16,
they have to decide

which group they
want to live in.

And they have to
stay in that group
for the rest of their life.

And it's about this girl
named Beatrice, or Trice.

And she takes the test, and she
doesn't get a normal result.

And I can't tell
you what the result

is, cause that's
the entire book.

But let's just say that
causes some problems
with the government.

And there's lots of action and
lots of romance in this movie.

And it's just definitely a
great book for anyone to read.
-My book is called Delirium.
And it's a really good book.

My mom actually just finished
it, and she really liked it.

It's about a society
where love is disease.

And every 16-year-old
goes in and has

a surgery that makes
them immune to love.

So they can't fall
in love anymore.

And it's about a
girl named Lena.

And she's one of those
good, obedient citizens,
like, law-abiding citizens.

And she's so excited to
get her cure from love.
But her best friend, Hannah--
-Is the rebellious type.

You know, the one
that always rebels
against all of the rules.

-And she actually draws
Lena into her rebellion.

And It kind of gets to
the point where Lena--
-Does the unthinkable.
She falls in love.
-And it's about her story.
And her life in this government.
it's such a good book.
You'll need to read it.
-Both of these books are great.

Thanks for watching
our book review.

Don't forget to leave a
comment below on a book

that you would
like us to review.

Please leave the
name and the author,

so we can figure out which
book you're talking about.

And don't forget to
follow us on Facebook
on Brooklyn and Bailey.

And we will see
you guys next week.
Bye.
-See ya.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
-Eww.
Stop.
-Eww.
-Oh my gosh.
I can do that with my knee.
-Oh.
it's starting to be broken.

-Maybe you're like, doing
something wrong to your bone.
-No, this is the wrist i broke.
I think.
-Wait, don't.

I'm afraid you're
hurting your wrist.
Oh!
Oh my gosh.
-Eww.
Doesn't even hurt.
It just pops.
Oh!
That was a big one.
